This game is stunning. And cool. It's really innovative.
One of the things I love about this game is how efficient it is with computation. My computer isn't able to run newer games and has a built-in Intel chipset, and even then, this game never lagged or slowed down.

And, of course, there's the portals. Yes, of course. They're puzzling, but fun! The game keeps you thinking constantly on how you need to solve a puzzle. It's just to satisfying to finish a puzzle after some thinking without looking at a walkthrough.

It's an amazing game, with amazing voice acting, and cool graphics. I'd give it a 20/10.
Very fun puzzle game. 'Thinking with portals' indeed. A bit on the short side, but a thought-provoking experiment indeed.
Do you need to buy this game? YES!

I haven't completed this game yet, but it's definitely worth it if you're interested in puzzles and unusual gameplay mechanics. The first handful of puzzles are fairly easy to figure out if you think and take notice of where everything is, and the portal gun itself is very fun to play around with if you want to. 

One trick you can do with the portal gun is fire a portal onto the ceiling (note that some ceilings and floors don't make portals) and one in the same position on the floor. When you jump into the floor portal, you will fall out of the ceiling portal and hopefully back into the one on the floor. So you can essentially make a never-ending loop with both portals that way.

There may be screen-tearing in the game (I had it myself), but hopefully you can fix it by enabling V-sync (which worked for me).

EDIT: Portal is amazing, and so is Portal 2!
Me quede tan mareado despues de jugar tanto con los portales que recomiendo el juego totalmente, es una maravilla que.... bueno solo compralo
Portal nÃ£o Ã© muito longo e muito menos Ã© tÃ£o revolucionÃ¡rio quanto as outras franquias da Source Engine. Mas seu carisma e a curta mas doce expÃªriencia que o jogo traz compensa.

Portal! 
First off let me say that portal is a really good game! I've known what it was for a long time but never got around to actually playing it myself. And when I finally did, I just kinda wished I played it sooner. Overall the game is pretty interesting and holds pretty dang well for being well...an older game. If you can get it and Portal 2 together don't wait even though they do go on sale often it's a fun series and is still really cool! (This didn't really say anything about what Portal is...but all you need to know is there's portals and the cake...yeah totally, cake that's definitely in there....)
I got the game on sale for $2.90. I finished the thing in one night and instantly bought portal 2. It was well worth it, now I am doing the developer commentary and bonus missions.

Portal is a very fun game filled with engaging gameplay and great humor! I loved playing this game after work with my (no children) family. The puzzles are fun to figure out and didn't get too repetitive. Great casual game with some violence.
much puzzle. very fun, very short... sad.
just a all round great game

I have completed this game, so it feels fine for me to write this as an honest review. Portal is a great game, 9.5/10. It was very enjoyable to play through. It can be difficult at times, but not crazy difficult. The game sometimes doesn't give you sufficient instructions and you're forced to try and experiment to find out what to do, but in the long run that makes it more enjoyable. However I will say that for people who shouldn't be on games with cuss words, this game is clean except for 2 things. The first is that at one point in it, the robotic voice with you for the entire game says something along the lines of "Remember, Android Hell exists." Besides that, the voice talks a lot about death, mostly in a funny way, so if that's a problem, think it over. The song that plays at the end of the game also revolves a lot about death and still being alive and such, but you can just mute it, although it is rather catchy. I hope this helped. Thanks for reading.

This game is a classic and my favorite game of all time! The dialogue is witty and full of humor and the small secrets add so much to this already amazing game! GLaDOS is a hilarious character and the voice of her just adds a cherry on top! The only other puzzle game that could rival the likes of Portal is the sequel to it, Portal 2. 10/10 Would recommend over and over again!

After finishing this game i realized what is wrong with most games nowadays. It's the lack of love and care for the games, in these days the teams making the games work extra hours against their will while in these case the game was made by an incredible team. It's all there, all that makes a game be a game (be fun), it's: the comedy, puzzles, the freedom you have while playing, the story and most important the fun. I do recomend it even if you are reading this in 2090, it never ages.
